title: Airlines' answer for congested airports and rising costs: Bigger planes
description: Airlines are turning to bigger planes that fit more travelers to handle strong demand.

title: Diddy still pays Sting '$5,000 a day' for sampling his hit song 'Every Breath You Take' 26 years ago
description: Sting once joked that he 'put a couple of my kids through college' with the royalties he's gotten from Diddy over the years.

title: Michael Jordan sneakers, Kobe Bryant gear lead blockbuster Sotheby's auction
description: Michael Jordan's signed 1998 sneakers are the cornerstone of a two-part Sotheby's auction of game-worn sports memorabilia.

title: In Nicole Chung’s memoir, "A Living Remedy," she blames U.S. health care for her parents' early deaths
description: In Nicole Chung's new memoir, "A Living Remedy," she tells the story of watching her aging parents get sicker from illnesses they couldn't afford to treat.

title: Elon Musk wants to pause 'dangerous' AI development. Bill Gates disagrees—and he's not the only one
description: An open letter calling for a development pause on AI systems like ChatGPT has more than 13,500 signatures — but Bill Gates and AI developers are pushing back.

title: Disney names first brand chief as Iger refocuses on core properties
description: Disney named Asad Ayaz as its first-ever chief brand officer, as CEO Bob Iger works to refocus the company on its core entertainment properties.

title: Starbucks customers are complaining about stomach issues from new olive oil-infused coffee
description: One customer described the Oleato beverage line as a "legit laxative."

title: Australian regulator cancels Binance's license at exchange's own request
description: Facing a probe from the Australian Securities & Investments Commission, Binance asked the regulator to cancel its derivatives license.

title: Wind and solar power generators wait in yearslong lines to put clean electricity on the grid, then face huge interconnection fees they can't afford
description: Interconnection applications and fees make it slow and expensive for clean energy providers to connect to the electrical grid.

title: March's banking chaos gave short sellers their biggest profits since the financial crisis
description: Short sellers were sitting on more than $7 billion in profit from the mass sell-off of bank shares last month, according to data firm Ortex.

title: 'We're not out of the woods': Sweden’s sliding house prices could be only halfway to the bottom
description: Sweden has long had one of Europe's hottest housing markets, but prices have tumbled, and are not set to recover for a long time, according to Danske Bank.

title: Sterling is the best performing G10 currency this year, and strategists remain cautiously optimistic
description: The British pound is the best performing G-10 currency of 2023, and some strategists believe that the pound's rally can continue over the medium term.

title: Shares of family-owned UAE exchange Al Ansari Financial Services surge in Dubai trading debut
description: Shares surged over 17% for the remittances and money exchange firm, which marks the first IPO for Dubai this year.

title: France's Macron starts tough talks with China's Xi Jinping as EU-Sino relations are at a crossroads
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen are having conversations with China's President Xi Jinping at a critical time in their relationship.

title: Malaysia is back on investors' radar and wants to work with U.S. and China, says trade minister
description: Malaysia is determined to work with both the U.S. and China, Malaysia's trade minister told CNBC amid ongoing tensions between the two economic giants.

title: Here's when millions of UK phones will sound an emergency test alarm
description: Most U.K. cell phones will sound an alarm for 10 seconds later this month as the government tests a new emergency alert system.

title: A hidden time bomb? A 'Big Short' investor sees financial disaster brewing in housing markets
description: Dave Burt, CEO of investment research firm DeltaTerra Capital, believes an overlooked climate risk could see history repeating itself in the housing market.

title: Exhaustion pervades Russia and Ukraine's forces fighting for Bakhmut's ruins
description: A recent lull in fighting in Bakhmut has been down to poor weather and exhaustion, Western officials said.

title: These are the countries that will be 'most hit' if oil prices reach $100
description: OPEC+ announced an output cut of 1.16 million barrels per day, and some are forecasting $100 per barrel. That could hurt some countries more than others.

title: IMF says U.S-China tensions could cost the world about 2% of its output
description: Companies and policymakers are exploring ways to make their supply chains more resilient by "moving production home or to trusted countries," the IMF said.
